subtitle: It can harm your baby inside you
description: It can harm your baby inside you
title: What is high blood pressure?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

High blood pressure can mean that your baby does not get all the food and oxygen he needs, so he may be born very small and weak. It can also make you very ill, and cause fits, especially in later pregnancy.

You may not feel any different if you have high blood pressure, so it is important to see a doctor or nurse at the local health centre to check your blood pressure regularly while you are pregnant.

A wide cuff will be put around your arm to measure your blood pressure. It will not hurt but it feels tight for a few moments. Your doctor or nurse will write the results down so that you have a record of your blood pressure at each visit. She will compare the measurements at each visit so he can spot any problems.

You are more likely to get high blood pressure if you are very overweight. Do not add salt to food. If you already have high blood pressure, this will make it worse.

There are medicines to control high blood pressure. See a doctor or nurse at the local health centre regularly, so any problems can be found early and you can get the right medicine.
